Based on the preferences you provided, I would recommend "Where'd You Go, Bernadette" (2012). The movie is about a woman who has been sacrificing her creative passions for years in order to support her family. After an amazing first date with Ben, Bea's fiery attraction turns ice-cold -- until they find themselves unexpectedly reunited at a wedding in Australia. So they do what any two mature adults would do: pretend to be a couple.
The movie is well-made and has a strong cast including Anette Nissenbaum as Bernadette, Sam Rockwell as Ben, Felicity Jones as Emma, and John Travolta as Frank.
Overall, "Where'd You Go, Bernadette" (2012) is a well-made and entertaining movie that I would highly recommend to anyone who enjoys movies.
